formalpara.title: Figure 6. A few remarkable and common worms that are easy to distinguish from Caenorhabditis (part II: rhabditids).
formalpara.para: See Section 3.1.3. for comments. The ‘m', ‘f’ or ‘h’ near the basal pharyngeal bulb of an individual indicates its sex: male, female, or hermaphrodite, respectively. In the upper-right panel, the arrowhead denotes vulva position (the male is mating and an embryo has just been laid).
